intro: Avonia albissima, commonly known as the white avonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. Avonia albissima is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
